abstract: Prosecutors in federal trial of Ross W Ulbricht, man accused of creating online black market called Silk Road, read entries from Ulbricht's journal to jury; argue that journal presents clear evidence that Ulbricht intentionally aimed to create a marketplace for drugs and other illegal goods.
lead_paragraph: Reading from what they say is his diary, prosecutors in Federal District Court highlighted Ross W. Ulbricht’s ideas for starting and expanding the online black market.
snippet: Reading from what they say is his diary, prosecutors in Federal District Court highlighted Ross W. Ulbricht’s ideas for starting and expanding the online black market.

headline.main: In Journal, Man Wrote of Creating Silk Road, an Online Black Market, Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: Man Wrote of Creating Illicit Site, Jury Is Told
